text: View the prototypes and task background here.
For Prototype 1, which design did you prefer?
For prototype 1, how strongly do you agree that your preferred design is a clear and discoverable way to access caption settings?
For prototype 1, how strongly do you agree that the position of the settings icon is discoverable and understandable?
Enter any additional comments or concerns you may have about Prototype 1.
answers: something like a 'C' for captions seems more intuitive
If it opens settings, it should be the gear.  If it is another type of menu, it should be the kebab.
I think it is a great idea to add subtitles settings where the subtitles are.

text: For prototype 2, which design did you prefer?
For prototype 2, how strongly do you agree that your preferred design is a clear and discoverable way to ascertain caption status?
For prototype 2, how strongly do you agree that 'c' is an appropriate keyboard shortcut to enable/disable captions?
If not, explain or offer an alternative keyboard shortcut below.
Enter any additional comments or concerns you may have about Prototype 2.
answers: Coloring the caption icon can be an issue with people who are color blind
I think the underline looks cleaner.  I'd keep it consistent with the other options though.  If they all get colored in, I'd do the same here.  I also prefer a CC button.
It is great that you can set subtitles with a shortcut. It acts the same way as YouTube so it can help with recall.
I believe Youtube uses C as well, so this is a great way to keep things consistent.
Some people may be colored blind and not be able to tell something is happening with the fill icon.
the color red can also mean off, so can be confusing for some
If I did not know about this shortcut, then is there an easy way for me to discover it?

text: For Prototype 3, how strongly do you agree that this is an appropriate location for the caption settings to appear?
For prototype 3, how strongly do you agree that the menu effectively suggests to the user what options are available?
Enter any additional comments or concerns you may have about Prototype 3.
answers: It maybe be a bit too clutered and too small for big screens.
Can you change the actual subtitle to see what it looks like?
at face value it looks like too many buttons. maybe make some decisions on behalf of user?
I do not like that the video pauses completely.
Most people turn on subtitles as a quick way. I think having this in settings will be more aappropriate rather than have it in the middle of the screen
I think there are too many customization options here. It's unnecessary and could be overwhelming for users
I feel like it would be better to appear in the same place that the captions menu had originally opened on the right, but I would be okay with the center too

text: How strongly do you agree that the proposed prototypes reduce the distance between the user and their task of editing captions on Netflix?
If you do not agree that the prototypes reduce the distance between the user and their task, enter an explanation below.
answers: Easiest way to do this is to have a CC button (instead of the little text bubble graphic) on the controller and on screen.  A hotkey is good - C works fine as default
3 is a bit much for me
having the ability to change the look of the subtitles helps decrease distance

text: Enter any additional insight about the proposed prototypes here.
answers: Will your preferred settings be remembered?
I think prototypes 1 and 2 can be combined together.
I think 1 and 2 work the best and 2 can become an invisible interface
